Jrd Derby forwards the subjoined, note "by the Master-General of the Ordnance with reference to Minute 6 of War Cabinet 102of 22nd March, 1917.Enquiries from the yield Marshal Commanding-in-Chief in France have elicited the following preliminary reply which will he supplemented as soon as possible.The 14 lh. shield (of which 400 per Division have been or are being issued) while possessing a certain value in stationary trench warfare, is considered too heavy for use in an advance.Reports have been called for as to :-(a) The value of the lighter (6 lb.) pattern armour.(b) The efficacy of armour generally.As regards (a) samples for trial having only recently been supplied some little time must necessarily elapse before a report can be rendered, and as regards (b) it is feared that there-will be great difficulty in obtaining reliable figures.DERBY.April, 1917.^liimn iiimiiiiiMwiiii iii' i
